elements.title: Portrait of George Washington Taking the Salute at Trenton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the head in the Portrait of George Washington Taking the Salute at Trenton (pictured) is based on the work of another painter?

elements.title: Werner Pinzner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that contract killer Werner Pinzner fatally shot the investigating public prosecutor, his own wife, and himself at the Hamburg police headquarters?

elements.title: Comp-Sultants (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that David H. Ahl called Comp-Sultants one of the first casualties of the microcomputer revolution?

elements.title: Jett Howard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that college basketball player Jett Howard almost signed at Tennessee, but instead chose the Michigan team of his father Juwan Howard?

elements.title: prosecuted for comparing the Turkish President Erdoğan to Gollum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one could get prosecuted for comparing the Turkish President Erdoğan to Gollum, a character from The Lord of the Rings?

elements.title: Bellwood station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that tickets of the Chicago Aurora and Elgin Railroad could be purchased for Bellwood station at a local drug store?

elements.title: Chris Lewis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1998, Chris Lewis and other volunteer despammers on Usenet went on a labor strike?

elements.title: Lady Rainier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lady Rainier has been raising a glass since 1903?
